body_html: You should be able to use the existing tf.nn.static_state_saving_rnn() function with a tf.data input pipeline and a tf.contrib.training.SequenceQueuingStateSaver. Note that the latter relies on queues and queue-runners, so you'll still need to call tf.train.start_queue_runners().
body_text: You should be able to use the existing tf.nn.static_state_saving_rnn() function with a tf.data input pipeline and a tf.contrib.training.SequenceQueuingStateSaver. Note that the latter relies on queues and queue-runners, so you'll still need to call tf.train.start_queue_runners().
body: You should be able to use the existing [`tf.nn.static_state_saving_rnn()`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/nn/static_state_saving_rnn) function with a `tf.data` input pipeline and a [`tf.contrib.training.SequenceQueuingStateSaver`](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/contrib/training/SequenceQueueingStateSaver). Note that the latter relies on queues and queue-runners, so you'll still need to call `tf.train.start_queue_runners()`.
